content:
Diagnosis
	1. Metastatic prostate adenosquamous carcinoma with leptomeningeal and bone metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	None

	Radiotherapy
	15 Mar 2024 - Completed whole brain radiotherapy 20Gy in 5 fractions

	Chemotherapy
	Carboplatin/Etoposide from 01 Feb 2024 - discontinued after 2 cycles due to clinical deterioration

	Clinical studies
	Phase II trial of Pembrolizumab in rare prostate cancer variants - commenced 01 Apr 2024

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with worsening neurological symptoms

	Current issues
	Headaches, confusion, right-sided weakness

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today for trial assessment. Performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 3. Experiencing grade 3 immune-related hepatitis with ALT 450, AST 380. MRI brain shows progressive leptomeningeal disease despite recent WBRT. CSF cytology positive for malignant cells. Latest PSA risen to 12.4 from 3.2 at baseline.

Neurological symptoms have significantly worsened with increased confusion, persistent headaches, and new right-sided weakness grade 3/5. Now requiring wheelchair for mobility and increased care support at home.

Trial discontinuation criteria met due to both clinical deterioration and grade 3 immune-related toxicity. Decision made to withdraw from trial after discussion with patient and family.

	Further investigations
	Urgent CT chest/abdomen/pelvis to assess extent of progression

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone 4mg BD
Prednisolone 60mg daily for immune-related hepatitis

	Follow up
	Urgent referral to palliative care team
Review in general oncology clinic in 1 week

	Required GP actions
	Daily district nurse visits for support
Monitor LFTs twice weekly
Urgent consideration for hospice referral

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: PD-L1 90%, PSA risen to 12.4 from baseline 3.2

cancer_timeline.value: Discontinued Carboplatin/Etoposide after 2 cycles due to clinical deterioration
Completed whole brain radiotherapy 20Gy in 5 fractions
Commenced Phase II trial of Pembrolizumab in rare prostate cancer variants
CSF cytology positive for malignant cells
MRI brain shows progressive leptomeningeal disease despite recent WBRT

patient_facts.value: Grade 3 immune-related hepatitis with ALT 450, AST 380
Requires wheelchair for mobility and increased care support at home

status_updates.value: Metastatic prostate adenosquamous carcinoma with progressive leptomeningeal disease. Significant clinical deterioration with new neurological deficits and immune-related hepatitis requiring trial discontinuation
Grade 3 immune-related hepatitis requiring high-dose corticosteroids
Discontinued from Pembrolizumab trial due to clinical deterioration and immune-related toxicity
Deterioration to ECOG PS 3 with new neurological deficits requiring wheelchair
Urgent CT chest/abdomen/pelvis to assess extent of progression
Urgent palliative care referral and oncology review in 1 week
